channel.title: I cant add commands
channel.description:
Well when i try to add commands like ::acommands or ::bandos it doesnt work and i use espeon by the way. When i try to code in commands it sends a message here is a pic of it:
[IMG]http://i50.tinypic.com/11w4kcg.png[/img]
http://tinypic.com/r/11w4kcg/6
I dont understand what this means but when i try to compile it does the errors things here is a pic of it:
[IMG]http://i47.tinypic.com/2132m3m.png[/img]
http://tinypic.com/r/2132m3m/6
I dont understand what does either of these mean can someone please tell me how i can fix it and what these errors mean?
Thank you

item.title: I cant add commands
item.dc:creator: @reco reco
item.description:
@reco wrote:

[quote=“ry60003333, post:2, topic:342820”]The first “error” is just because you’ve opened the file in Wordpad instead of Notepad. Wordpad lets you add things like bold and underlining, but those aren’t supported in text-only files (like .java files). You can ignore that, or open the files in notepad.

The error when you compile is because you inserted the code in the wrong place, you screwed up the brackets, or there is actually a catch statement that isn’t paired with a try statement. Those look like this:

try { } catch (Exception ex) { }

And if you put a catch without a try, you get a compiler error.[/quote]

ok the 1st part how do i change it from wordpad into notepad? i tried to do it by clicking open with>notepad but then it still does wordpad. can you tell me how to change that?

2nd part:(im adding the command ::acommands) im adding a command and i put it in the commands file and it does that so im putting it in the right spot and im copying ::modcommands and replacing the right to 3 and changing it to acommands instead of modcommands. and then im adding the admin commands replacing the admin commands in with the mod commands. so wut am i doing wrong?

here is a picture of me how it looked when i added it:

29eosg7.png1600×640

http://tinypic.com/r/29eosg7/6

part 2 of it

21o7ryq.png1600×640

http://tinypic.com/r/21o7ryq/6

Read full topic

item.title: I cant add commands
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

The first “error” is just because you’ve opened the file in Wordpad instead of Notepad. Wordpad lets you add things like bold and underlining, but those aren’t supported in text-only files (like .java files). You can ignore that, or open the files in notepad.

The error when you compile is because you inserted the code in the wrong place, you screwed up the brackets, or there is actually a catch statement that isn’t paired with a try statement. Those look like this:

try { } catch (Exception ex) { }

And if you put a catch without a try, you get a compiler error.

Read full topic
